title: Album Page, "Plan View of Opening with Columnar Support", late 19th century
medium: Graphite, trace of brush and gray wash on off-white wove paper with deckled edge tipped into binding with fabric
markings: Watermark: Double inscribed circle containing an anchor, each terminal ending in an arrow.
inscribed: Recto, in graphite: fall of about 1.0 (?). Sheet contains other inscriptions of measurements.  Verso, in graphite, upper right corner: 120; lower right corner: 113.
dimensions: Sheet: 31.1 x 21.2 cm (12 1/4 x 8 3/8 in.), irregular
description: Vertical sheet with plan view of section of wall that forms one component of an opening or doorway that is supported in the center by columnar element, and flanked at right by another section of wall of a rectangular space.

tombstone.epitaph: Album Page, "Plan View of Opening with Columnar Support", late 19th century.Graphite, trace of brush and gray wash on off-white wove paper with deckled edge tipped into binding with fabric. Gift of Mrs. William Greenough. 1943-51-287.
